author: paulmb
title: ISIG-GOMA Cardano Hub
description: Students in Africa and especially those in the DRC (Francophone) are lagging behind in the development of Blockchain and its usefulness.

f6_assessments.q0: ISIG-GOMA Cardano Hub is a good initiative that can help students in Africa especially DRC students have more opportunities to be exposed to blockchain and especially they have the opportunity to learn more about Cardano, Haskell . This gives students the opportunity to receive Plutus, Atala Prism scholarships and importantly also helps students see the opportunity to start a business and participate in Catalyst. This will help the Cardano community grow stronger and deeper in the Africa region.
f6_assessments.q1: Paul Mupenda, Manfo, Nkalla and other team members are all experienced in the technology field. More than that, they are both enthusiasts and are contributing a lot in the Cardano ecosystem. I believe that with the capacity and experience of the group, you will do well in this proposal. A big plus for you is that you have given very detailed and complete information for the community to see the capacity and experience of each group member through the links. It is also a good idea to provide refreshments or provide travel money for students to come to you as it can get more people to participate in this proposal. However, I think you also need to be prepared for the situation where there are too many people involved. If this happens, how will you handle it?
f6_assessments.q2: I think the roadmap you give needs to be more specific and detailed about each stage so that the community can monitor and evaluate the progress of your work. Phase 1 you give in the first 3 months. How long will phase 2 and 3 take? In addition, some expenditures in the $12,000 budget also need to be clarified. Example: $5000 for speaker motivation. Specifically, how will this money be spent? The more transparent you are about your finances, the more the community will support you. The KPIs you give are also very clear and completely easy to measure in numbers.
f6_assessments.reply: Auditability: Phase 2 and 3 are more geared towards support being received from the Cameroon hub's hackathons. Therefore the timeline for those phases is based on their timeline and can be found in more detail in the linked proposals. We tried to make it clear through the proposal that we would be joining the two initiatives and the financial support received through this proposal would be towards supporting DRC participation in these events, plus 3 in person events (with travel costs to cover visit from Cameroon Hub Leads/Trainers).

f6_assessments.q0: The core aim of the 'Grow Africa, Grow Cardano' initiative is to increase Cardano awareness and understanding on the African continent. The goal of this proposal is to establish a student hub in Goma to inspire young developers to choose Cardano through conferences and hackathons promoting Haskell and Plutus. Students in Africa, particularly those in the DRC (Francophone), are lagging behind in the development of Blockchain and its usefulness. By 2023, this will have gone a long way toward making Cardano the blockchain of choice in Africa. This proposal illustrates Cardano tech use-case solutions in a straightforward and concise manner. As a result, I am convinced that this proposal effectively addresses the problem
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is a computer science student with prior Haskell programming expertise who possesses the requisite skills to carry out the idea. Wada's team has demonstrated their understanding and competence in block chain, notably Cardano, throughout time, and they also possess the essential skills to carry out the strategy. The proposer has clearly indicated the kind and quantity of team members required to carry out the plan, as well as a budget that is broken down into smaller parts and suitable for meeting the set goals. A realistic schedule for finishing the work is also included in the proposal, as well as a clear and actionable implementation plan that indicates what is being done and how it is being done. The proposer has considered the challenges that may arise during implementation and suggested possible solutions. Hence, problem solution listed has a high chance being implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal comprises a timeline and milestones, as well as metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) that determine the proposal's success. The proposal offers a clear explanation of the targeted problem as well as a remedy that solves the problem similarly. As a result, the information given is adequate to audit the proposal's development and success.

f6_assessments.q0: There is a shortage of health developers to create health applications. By using their own platform Hippocrades it would be easier to make these apps. They would offer guides and tutorials here which would make an app much easier. The infrastructure would serve to run on web 3.0. This could encourage developers. The difficulty is that it may not be possible to produce the valuable materials. The participation of the core team of Hhippocrades will ensure that everything runs smoothly.
f6_assessments.q1: Founder Dale already founded a health technology startup. He also ran a soft dev company for 11 years. He can use this experience to further realize this project. The other members contributing to this proposal are not listed. The team has been building healthcare solutions since 2016. The budget overview is unclear. The costs that have to be incurred should be better prepared. No additional resources are required as most of the build continues on an existing platform. A clear timetable is included in the proposal. The campaign costs required to promote this proposal have also not been taken into account. The risks included will be resolved by the Hippocrades core team. The creators already have experience working on their platforms. The team assumes that the problems in this project can be solved internally so that a successful implementation can take place. It might be better to translate the platform and material into different languages spoken in Africa.
f6_assessments.q2: The team will be using grithub to closely monitor the development of this project. The submitter will make use of a checklist in which you can check off when a task has been completed. When they are all done, everything can be done. It says that the production of the tutorials and material will be divided into the team and posted on the website. It would be useful to mention all the different milestones in this proposal. A short roadmap is available that states what the team wants to achieve in 4 months. This could have been elaborated a bit more for me. The production of these materials makes it easier for developers in Africa to build a health application. This proposal therefore offers a solution to the requested problem.

f6_assessments.q0:
Attract more people to board the Cardano ecosystem is one of the objectives of this challenge.
This proposal presents a series of activities including hosting events, hackathons and training of leaders about Cardano. This aligns ewith the challenge and may have an impact if the results of the project are met as described.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team is composed by peoplewho have expertise in the field of software developement, programming and open to get support from the Wada, which is a great organisation working in Cardano ecosystem and support and guide various groups and individuals in Africa to get familiar with Cardano. These elements would be assets for success for this proposal. However, the budget is not detailed and incentives are not clearly set on how would they be used. An iea would be to give to participants in ADA value and opening up wallet to each of the beneficiary. That way, the participants will by then be boarding while staking, investing and using ADA crypto.
What strategy would be used to reach out to potential participants? Incentive to attract them? Those would be some of important questions to respond to for the success of the current proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The community would track the success of this proposal by following the results, but the team hasn't explained the system in place by which the community evaluation would be done.
Also,  developing the participants satisfaction survey after each project activity woulld be another aspect of evaluation .

f6_assessments.q0: Then problem described here fits into the challenge setting. The goals of the proposal are in alignment with the challenge setting. One of the goal in this proposal is to launch a student hub in Goma to inspire young developers to choose Cardano through conferences and hackathons promoting Haskell and Plutus is a big win for Cardano blockchain. The metrics as well fits into the challenge. This has the potential of reaching out to many developers in the long term term, the scalability is very high.
f6_assessments.q1: I believe the team is well equipped to execute the project considering information provided and their relevant experience. The budget is well explained and I am sure the amount is reasonable to achieve the set goals. The plan presented is detailed with a clear and definite timeline, because one can tell the commencement and completion of the project. It’s good effort to include challenges and risks that may arise during the implementation of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap provided is very comprehensive and detailed with clear milestones and time horizon. The metrics/KPIs were excellently chosen as they tell the number of attendees expected over time amongst others. There is clarity in the targeted problem with a solution I believe can tackle the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: I am always surprised by the impact that Cardano has on so many people whenever I read these types of proposals. This time around, the proposal team brings up the issue of a shortage of skilled developers to develop considering the blockchain technology as well as the Cardano ecosystem itself. It is important to engage with local stakeholders in carrying out projects that solve real problems in the market, in order to add up value to the ecosystem and have a positive impact on it as well the whole Project Catalyst idea as the proposer states that they are going to encourage students to participate not only as community advisors but also apply their proposals (with the needed help) through Catalyst, which is completely aligned with the challenge settings. Building hubs has become very popular, but useful as well, so i believe that this proposal would be able to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: I really like the idea of providing the LinkedIn profiles of all the team members that will take part in implementing this proposal, and also giving a clear overview of the skills and past accomplishments. The proposal's plan defined to implement this proposal is clear and sufficient for me. The budget request covers the three phases described, and it is broken down into five clearly identifiable line items. There is enough information provided to enable a proper assessment. As the amount requested varies considerably depending on the local context, I cannot determine whether or not the requested amounts are appropriate. Yet, I understand how they will be allocated, and from that perspective it seems that the task was successfully accomplished. Something i would point out is that, practically, there is no timetable for the proposal to follow but only the definition, which i don't doubt that is very clear, of the phases. The risks and the mitigation of them, as well as the resources needed, have been also clearly described and that is very helpful for the people voting to know.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is very good in relation to the aspects which are necessary to assess auditability. The key metrics have been very clearly identified and quantified as well. I really believe that the phase 1, phase 2... roadmap should be changed into a time-defined roadmap and due to the complexity of the proposal, I am of the opinion that the voters need to know when each phase is going to take place. One thing to notice is the way to track the progress of the proposal. Is that the LinkedIn profiles you referred to? Making that clear enough, would make this proposal undoubtedly auditable.
